w:r.w:t: This lesson will teach the student about clothes and various clothes objects. It would be helpful to use a shirt, shoes, and dress as props.
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be learning and using
words about the clothes we wear!
Student sings the song and performs the action with the teacher
See what color the student is wearing and teach them this song

Circle the different clothes objects and have the student tell you what they are.

Circle the Shirt, Shoes, and Dress!

Student should match the child with the article of clothing

Count on your fingers as child counts shoes
If they are able, you can begin asking them questions about the shirts.
Count on your fingers as child counts shoes
Have the student circle the red dress
Circle the correct pictures to answer the questions
Have the student circle the correct answers. Use TPR to demonstrate a question and answer response.
“He is wearing a red shirt/blue shoes.”
Match the number to the correct clothing items
Student should say or write the correct word in the sentence frames

Otherwise, you can have them simply repeat your words.

filling in the blanks in the sentence frame
“I like to wear two blue shoes.”

Circle the second blank: “Let’s count the shoes!”
Circle the third blank: “What color are the shoes?”
Underline the boy who is wearing the blue shirt
Have the student underline the boy who is wearing a blue shirt. If time allows, talk about the other kids as well.
Student sings the goodbye song with the teacher
